intro: Swainsona colutoides, commonly known as the yellow trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
